content: Forest Gump had a rad soundtrack! That's if we are not including musical scores
A three way tie between these. Partly made in my hometown of St. Louis is #1. ,https://www.,youtube.com/watch?v=ZFfQw_,AJlUo, ,…, One of Kevin Costner's first.
The 2nd is Jeff Lynne from ELO was part of this one.,https://www.,youtube.com/watch?v=Ek08Kv,gqFGM, ,…
I think Heavy Metal is right up there.
Hard to go past purple rain but less obviously Dreams With Fishes. Not great film but good soundtrack
Reservoir Dogs (Steven Wright as DJ helps it) or The Big Lebowski (lots of dusty gems).
The jon spencer blues explosion - Bellbottoms from baby driver
Either the highlander or flash Gordon
Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
I love the entire soundtrack to the Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit movies
My favourite is Freddy vs Jason
Anything composed by Ennio Morricone. Hauntingly beautiful!
Guardians of the Galaxies, Awesome Mix Vol. 1
Dumb and Dumber...  I love the movie and the soundtrack!

Singles & The Crow
Altho I really like Heavens Prisoner as well.....great blues music
The Wall by Pink Floyd / The Mission
Grown Ups, Guardians of the Galaxy, and The Blues Brothers.
Tough question. I'm leaning towards "That Thing You Do" soundtrack.
Singles is my favorite but can't forget Purple Rain and This is Spinal Tap
Tron Legacy soundtrack was pretty bad ass
Purple Rain. Didn’t really like the movie, but the soundtrack is great.
Just one? Love: Gladiator, Last of the Mohicans, Vision Quest, Daredevil, Say Anything
Goodmorning Vietnam / Tropic Thunder / Forest Gump
There are SO many...for starters, all the Star Wars!
Scott Pilgrim vs the World and O' Brother Where Are Thou.
All listed thus far are great soundtracks. I add swordfish to the mix. And clerks.
The soundtrack for Paprika by Susumu Hirasawa.
Fast Times at Ridgemont High an oldie but a goodie

Alone In The Dark
Spawn 
Judgment Night
Ned Kelly(1970)
